column5: Hey everyone !  @ about 2 am this morning, the gf and I will be making the drive to Kentucky lake (10 hrs), I will be fishing the BFL regional there. I am fishing as a co-angler against 199 other co-anglers ! This is my first year of competitive bass fishing and I only have 4 other tournaments under my belt so needless to say, this is a pretty big deal to me ! haha First place in this tourny is a 198VX Ranger with a 200 E-Tec !  I guess I'm asking for some wishes of luck from our great OFC community !!! haha and I promise, If I come back with the boat behind my truck .... all of you are invited to fish with me !!!!!!!!! hahah  Ill report back in 5 days !!!  Talk to you soon !
Wow best of luck man, thats going to be a awesome experience. Get some good weigh in pictures and photos of the pro's monsters!   Good Luck, MTBF
Must be nice! Good luck, show them what us canucks can do to their bass.
Good luck man!  New boat would be nice!
Thats awesome dude. Hope you get into a double didgit. Best of Luck!!!!
have fun fishing and if you win, that will be a huuuge bonus. It sure beats the heck out of working.
very cool, enjoy the experience .....take photos
win that boat and take me down there to the next one  good luck man!!
Best of luck Lunker. Kick some bass
Good luck and win or lose I hope you enjoy every minute of it.
aounds like a great opportunity ! good luck !

Thanks everyone !!!!  I made it back safe and sound.... with out a boat though ! hahah  Day 1 - Good partner, we travelled 79 mile to our spot... so 158 miles round trip ! haha thats a looooooooooooonnnng trip on the boat ! The fish didnt turn on till late, we only had about an hour left to fish... we both only managed 1 keeper. But that one keeper was good enough for 48th place out of 152 boats. 2 lbs 3 oz. ! hahahah  Day 2 - Well.... its tough to stay positive when you meet your boater for the day and he asks... " Do YOU know anywhere to fish on this lake ??? " ....hmmm.... needless to say it was a pretty slow day... basically we studied a map while waiting to take off and fished areas we thought might be good. I blanked on the second day, as did my boater.... so home I came !!!  All in all it was a good time !!! It was great to fish a new lake, well two new lakes... KY Lake and Barkley Lake. Resevoir fishing is a whole new ball game and I will be back.
Steep learning curve huh? Sounds like an adventure none-the-less. I think anyone here would have loved to give it a shot. nice try!
